Your Hospitality CV
Thank you for registering your interest in Hospitality
In order to be considered for the assessments at Marriott Hotels in July you must now complete a CV for the Hospitality pathway.
Marriott Hotels are looking for confident and dynamic individuals to play key roles in operational and service hubs across their most well-known London hotels. In order to stand out you need to make sure that your CV includes any relevant experience you already have in Hospitality and that it shows a real passion for the industry.
We've included some hints and tips below on how to make your CV the best that it can be. Make sure to read it carefully before downloading and completing the Hospitality CV template attached.
You should email your CV back to us at step.forward@the-challenge.org with 'Hospitality CV' in the subject by Friday 17th June. Successful candidates will then be invited to Marriot Hotels' assessments in July.
Good luck!
Hints and Tips
What could you be doing?
Marriott are offering roles within the following departments:
Front Desk (guest relations), Front Desk (Bookings), Food and Beverage (bar, restaurant, banqueting, room services) and Housekeeping.
You will be applying for all 4 departments and Marriott will decide on the best candidate for each role. This means that your CV must cover as much experience as possible for each role available.
How to make your CV stand out
A good way to make sure you stand out is to ensure that your CV is really relevant to the kind of candidate that Marriott are looking for.
We've attached the Marriott job description to this email, please download it and make sure that you read it thoroughly. Look carefully at the 'key responsibilities' for each role and include any experience you have had in this area e.g. customer service. Remember to be as specific as possible about your experiences and what you learnt from it.
We've also included some example suggestions on the CV to get you started. Make sure not to copy these examples, you need to show Marriott who you are as a candidate by talking about your own experiences in your own way.
If you follow these guidelines, you'll be sure to write a great CV.
